artist: Artist: Hashiguchi Goyō (self-published); Carver: Koike Masazō; Printer: Somekawa Kanzō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and torso of woman with very long hair, combing with a yellow comb; blue and white floral garment
markings: red artist\'s seal: はしぐち五葉 {Hashiguchi Goyō}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
provenance: Gallery Kabutoya (until 1984); Frederick B. Wells III (1984-2002)
signed: 五葉画 {Goyō ga} (picture by Goyō) | 大正九年三月 {Taishō kunen sangatsu} (March 1920)
text: Portrait of Kodaira Tomi 小平とみ.
title: Woman Combing Her Hair
